model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Have you talked to your advisor about your career options? Teaching is probably a good idea since it is a more guaranteed job.
Yes, I did talk to my advisor and it was very stressful. Deciding my whole life when I am really unsure! But I think I will get into teaching, it is a stable career.
It sounds like something that you would really like and be good at! I hope it works out. I would love to teach robotics someday.
That is so cool, you must be really smart! I imagine your parents are so proud.
Well I'm studying computer science and learning a lot! My parents are great, they are very supportive. What subject would you want to teach?
I would probably teach English, just because that is most in line with what I am studying. However, I have recently started becoming more interested in history so that is also an option.
Yes I think history is interesting, too! Both of those subjects would be great because there are probably lots of teaching jobs. What kind of history do you like?
I love all sorts of history. Right now I am really getting into the weeds of World War II. There's so much to unpack.
For sure! So much happened and it really affected how the world is today. I like learning about the history of places where I have lived, it's really interesting.
That sounds really cool! What have you learned about where you currently live?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Teaching and Career Paths', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B explore the idea of teaching and career options related to their fields.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: Yup I already volunteer at my mom's after school program. But I am looking to do more high level volunteering at the neighboring university in our town. Have you ever thought about maybe teaching at a college? ### Speaker A: Maybe community college, but it would have to courses in computer science.  I'd like to get involved with robotics. There is a lot of opportunity in this field and being able to teach it can really help advance my expertise. ### Speaker B: Yeah I feel like you could do so much with a computer science degree. It's really cool there are so many options! I feel a little bit stuck studying linguistics. I love it but the job opportunities are smaller.' }
```
